SEARCH
Package gw.api.financials

Class CurrencyAmount

java.lang.Object
gw.api.financials.CurrencyAmount
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMoney, IDimension<CurrencyAmount,BigDecimal>, ISequenceable<CurrencyAmount,BigDecimal,Currency>, GWRemotable, Comparable<CurrencyAmount>
public final class CurrencyAmount extends Object implements IMoney, GWRemotable, IDimension<CurrencyAmount,BigDecimal>, Comparable<CurrencyAmount>, ISequenceable<CurrencyAmount,BigDecimal,Currency>
Represents a monetary amount with a currency.

CurrencyAmounts can be used in two "modes". "Strict" CurrencyAmounts require a currency, and further require that their amounts have a scale appropriate for their currency. An attempt to create a "strict" CurrencyAmount (getStrict(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency) either with a null currency, or with a value that cannot be set to the currency scale without rounding, will fail.

"Non-strict" CurrencyAmounts can have any scale and have an optional currency. This mode exists primarily for backwards-compatibility. The methods that operate in "non-strict" mode have been deprecated. In Gosu, mathematical operators (e.g., +) can be used with CurrencyAmounts, and CurrencyAmounts are interchangeable with BigDecimals. These operations all occur in "non-strict" mode. That is, the results of these operations should be considered "non-strict" CurrencyAmounts.

This class contains many methods that exist on BigDecimal, in deprecated form. This is because in prior versions, CurrencyAmount extended BigDecimal. Now, it composes a BigDecimal and a Currency.

  • Field Details

    • NULL_SAFE_CURRENCY_THEN_AMOUNT_COMPARATOR

      public static final Comparator<CurrencyAmount> NULL_SAFE_CURRENCY_THEN_AMOUNT_COMPARATOR
      A CurrencyAmount comparator based on the following rules: - Nulls are treated as less than all other values. - If two CurrencyAmounts have different Currencies, then uses their Currency priority values for comparison. Otherwise, uses their amount values (BigDecimals) for comparison.

  • Constructor Details

    • CurrencyAmount

      public CurrencyAmount()
      Required for SOAP. A CurrencyAmount constructed with this constructor is not valid until both setAmount(java.math.BigDecimal) and setCurrency(typekey.Currency) have been called on it. Normal callers should use CurrencyAmount(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency) instead.

    • CurrencyAmount

      public CurrencyAmount(String s)
      Constructs a CurrencyAmount from a string. The string must be of the format <amount>[<SPACE><currency>], where amount is a string in a format accepted by
      invalid @link 
      {@link java.math.BigDecimal(String)
      }, and the (optional only in V7 mode) currency corresponds to a currency code. Required for XML de-serialization. Normal callers should use CurrencyAmount(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency) instead.

    • CurrencyAmount

      public CurrencyAmount(double val, Currency currency)
      Convenience constructor. NB: Using doubles for money is inherently risky. Doubles have a potentially lossy representation that can lead to inaccuracies. Consult the java language specification for details on floating point representations.
      Parameters:
      val - Amount that will be converted to BigDecimal
      currency - The currency of the instance.

      invalid @link 
      {@link #getStrict(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency).

    • add

      public CurrencyAmount add(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Add amount.getAmount() to this.getAmount()
      Returns:
      A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount.getAmount()) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • addAsSameCurrency

      public CurrencyAmount addAsSameCurrency(BigDecimal amount)
      Add amount to this. This is a convenience method and makes this: this.add(new BigDecimal(23)) semantically equivalent to this.add(new CurrencyAmount(new BigDecimal(23), this.getCurrency())
      Returns:
      A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

    • addAsSameCurrency

      Returns:
      A CurrencyAmount where getAmount() == this.getAmount().add(amount, mc) and getCurrency() == this.getCurrency()

      public int signum()

      Returns:

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(CurrencyAmount o)
      Compares this currency amount with another by comparing their numeric amounts. If both currency amounts specify a currency, then the currencies must be the same.

      See Comparable.compareTo(T) for an explanation of the int return value.

      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<CurrencyAmount>
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if both currency amounts specify a different non-null currency

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Two CurrencyAmounts are considered equal if the currencies are the same and the amounts are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Formats this currency amount as <amount>[<SPACE><currency>].
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      See Also:
      • CurrencyAmount(java.lang.String)

    • valueOf

      public static CurrencyAmount valueOf(IMoney money)
      Returns a CurrencyAmount whose amount and currency are equivalent to the given money. Returns null if either money or money.getAmount() is null.

    • fix

      public CurrencyAmount fix(RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Returns a CurrencyAmount with the same amount as this one, but with scale set to the appropriate value for the currency, and the currency set to the default currency if null. The amount is rounded according to the given rounding mode.

    • convert

      public CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Converts this CurrencyAmount into one in the given currency, according to the current market exchange rate, with the resulting amount rounded according to the given rounding mode.

      If either currency is null, or if the currencies are the same, returns this instance.

      This method works whether you are using legacy ExchangeRates or FXRates.

    • convert

      public CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Converts this CurrencyAmount into one in the given currency, according to the given exchange rate, with the resulting amount rounded according to the given rounding mode.

      If either currency is null, or if the currencies are the same, returns this instance.

      This method works whether you are using legacy ExchangeRates or FXRates.

    • compareMultiCurrency

      public static int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount amount1, CurrencyAmount amount2)
      Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

      Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount) .

    • compare

      public static int compare(CurrencyAmount amount1, CurrencyAmount amount2)
      Compares two money amounts, which may be null. Null money amounts are ordered before non-null money amounts.

      Otherwise, the currency amounts are compared according to compareTo(CurrencyAmount) .

    • compareMultiCurrency

      public int compareMultiCurrency(CurrencyAmount o)
      Compares this currency amount with another, which may be of a different currency. If both currency amounts specify a currency, and the currencies are different, then the given currency amount is converted into this currency amount's currency before the amounts are compared. The conversion is based on current market exchange rates and the result is rounded using the default rounding mode.

      After possible conversion, the currency amounts are compared according to compareTo(CurrencyAmount) .

    • setSecondaryMoneyComponent

      public CurrencyAmountPair setSecondaryMoneyComponent(CurrencyAmount secondaryMoneyComponent)
      Since a CurrencyAmount is immutable, this will return a new CurrencyAmount with the secondary component set if the current secondaryComponent and passed-in one are not equal.

    • addSecondaryMoneyComponent

      public CurrencyAmountPair addSecondaryMoneyComponent(Currency secondaryCurrency)
      Calculates the equivalent of this CurrencyAmount in the secondaryCurrency, and returns a new CurrencyAmount with that secondary CurrencyAmount as the SecondaryMoneyComponent.

      Does nothing if this.Currency and the secondaryCurrency are equal or null

      Returns:
      a new CurrencyAmount, same value as before, but with SecondaryMoneyComponent set.

    • addSecondaryMoneyComponent

      public CurrencyAmountPair addSecondaryMoneyComponent(Currency secondaryCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRate)
      Calculates the equivalent of this CurrencyAmount in the secondaryCurrency with the given exchangeRate, and returns a new CurrencyAmount with that secondary CurrencyAmount as the SecondaryMoneyComponent.

      Does nothing if this.Currency and the secondaryCurrency are equal or null

      Returns:
      a new CurrencyAmount, same value as before, but with SecondaryMoneyComponent set.

    • getStrict

      public static CurrencyAmount getStrict(BigDecimal amount, Currency currency)
      Constructs a CurrencyAmount from a BigDecimal amount and currency. The currency parameter cannot be null. The amount will be scaled as appropriate for the given currency, and the amount must not have more decimal digits than that scale allows. Use CurrencyUtil.roundToCurrencyScale(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency, java.math.RoundingMode) in preference to this method if rounding is required when scaling the BigDecimal. For example, if it is the result of a divide or multiply operation.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if the given amount cannot be scaled without rounding.
      NullPointerException - if the given currency is null
      See Also:
      • CurrencyUtil

    • addStrict

      public CurrencyAmount addStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Calculates this + amount. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
      Returns:
      a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if either of the operands has a scale that makes it impossible to return a result in the appropriate scale, without rounding.

    • subtractStrict

      public CurrencyAmount subtractStrict(CurrencyAmount amount)
      Subtracts two CurrencyAmounts. If both specify a currency, then the currencies must match. If one specifies a currency, then the result will be in that currency. If neither specifies a currency, then the result will be in the default currency.
      Returns:
      a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if either of the operands has a scale that makes it impossible to return a result in the appropriate scale, without rounding.

    • multiplyStrict

      public CurrencyAmount multiplyStrict(BigDecimal factor, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Multiplies this CurrencyAmount by the given factor, rounding the result according to the given rounding mode.
      Returns:
      a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.

    • divideStrict

      public CurrencyAmount divideStrict(BigDecimal factor, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      Divides this CurrencyAmount by the given factor, rounding the result according to the given rounding mode.
      Returns:
      a currency amount scaled appropriately for the associated currency.

    • absStrict

      public CurrencyAmount absStrict()
      Returns the absolute value of this CurrencyAmount.

    • negateStrict

      public CurrencyAmount negateStrict()
      Returns this * -1.

    • setScale

      @Deprecated public BigDecimal setScale(int newScale, int roundingMode)
      Deprecated.
      This class used to extend BigDecimal. This method is included for backward-compatibility. Instead, for this and other BigDecimal methods, use getAmount() to get the underlying BigDecimal, and call the method on that.

    • convert

      public CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency)
      Convert the current amount using the specified parameters.

      This method will only work if you are using FXRates. If you are using legacy ExchangeRates use one of these instead:

      • convert(typekey.Currency toCurrency, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      • convert(typekey.Currency toCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      • Any variant of CurrencyUtil.convertAmount(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency, typekey.Currency, java.math.BigDecimal)
      Parameters:
      toCurrency - target currency code.
      Returns:
      a new converted object.

    • convert

      public CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, FXRateMarket fxRateMarket)
      Convert the current amount using the specified parameters.

      This method will only work if you are using FXRates. If you are using legacy ExchangeRates use one of these instead:

      • convert(typekey.Currency toCurrency, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      • convert(typekey.Currency toCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride, RoundingMode roundingMode)
      • Any variant of CurrencyUtil.convertAmount(java.math.BigDecimal, typekey.Currency, typekey.Currency, java.math.BigDecimal)
      Parameters:
      toCurrency - target currency code.
      fxRateMarket - market rate type.
      Returns:
      a new converted object.

    • convert

      public CurrencyAmount convert(Currency toCurrency, FXRateMarket fxRateMarket, Date marketTime)

      This method will only work if you are using FXRates. If you are using legacy ExchangeRates use one of these instead:
